channel.title: Day two
channel.description:
It's day two messing around with RSC Private Servers
So, I've got around tons using the search button
looking at useful threads, tutorials, etc.
I have a few questions.
-Any recommended code editors?
-(Rscd sprite editor) The sprite editor came with files that I can unpack but theres no "Sprites.rscd", etc. that came with RSCD. I'm trying to pack things but theres no .RSCD file. (im trying to replace the logo at loading/login screen)
I'll update this post If I have anymore questions
Greetz,
Tony.

item.title: Day two
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Alright, I still need help on a few things…

I need to replace the graphic files but I actually don’t know where

they are. There’s no “.rscd” files where I can pack the .spr files

The RSCD v25 downloaded from here.

Which comes with a sprite editor, but I don’t fully understand how

everything with this works. I unpacked files

that came with another sprite editor (same but seperate download). The

files it unpacks in the “data” folder is Animations.xml, entity.dat, entity2.dt, media.dat, textures.dat, textures xml, npcdef.xml, items.xml.

But thats within the sprite editor folder and it’s not in RSCD. So how do I replace RSCD sprite files with these?

Read full topic

item.title: Day two
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“TonyNooblet, post:9, topic:224942”]Currently gathering all the exact quest data

like exactly what the NPC says, your options, etc which is originally the same

as RuneScape Classic. Right now I’ve got down the Cook’s Assistant.

Doing Black Knight’s Fortress at the moment.

Hopefully programming quests won’t be too hard :[/quote]
That could be the hardest part out of everything (if done correctly) or if done very shitty, it can be easy. If your new to programming and you go and tackle something like quests, your going to find so so many bugs in it that may cause dupes etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Day two
item.dc:creator: @Krypton1 Krypton
item.description:
@Krypton1 wrote:

If you don’t know much about coding I suggest you don’t bother wasting your time even bothering trying to create quests, they would be far too advanced for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Day two
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Editpadpro - lite?

Anyways, could anyone point my out on editing experience formulas?

I’m building on a server called ExactRSC until everything is perfect,

then hosted.

Greetz,

Tony.

item.title: Day two
item.dc:creator: @BuyMyJunk BuyMyJunk
item.description:
@BuyMyJunk wrote:

xEnt:

Eclipse / IntelliJ IDEA

forgot about eclipse haven’t been using it much lately
also recommend eclipse if you know how to set it up, to run the server and compile also

I would recommend notepad++ because its light, stable, fast and powerful all in one.
